name: From Array to Zay Trivia Game | Alphabetical Words | 25 Questions

questions.text: To reduce in intensity - What word, ending with a long a sound, has this definition?
questions.explanation:
allay.

	Or affray (to frighten).

questions.text: A meal served standing up - What word, ending with a long a sound, has this definition?
questions.explanation:
buffet.

	Or bouquet or bray or beret.

questions.text: A mountain cabin - What word, ending with a long a sound, has this definition?
questions.explanation:
chalet.

	Or chambray or clay.

questions.text: To put off - What word, ending with a long a sound, has this definition?
questions.explanation:
delay.

	Or dray or display or dismay.

questions.text: Ordinary - What word, ending with a long a sound, has this definition?
questions.explanation:
everyday.

	Can you think of any more?

questions.text: A piece of boneless meat or fish - What word, ending with a long a sound, has this definition? (US pronunciation)
questions.explanation:
fillet & filet.

	Or fray or flay.

questions.text: Someone who likes to eat fancy food - What word, ending with a long a sound, has this definition?
questions.explanation:
gourmet.

	Or gay or gray or grey.

questions.text: A cheer - What word, ending with a long a sound, has this definition?
questions.explanation:
hooray & hurray.

	Or hay or hey or heyday.

questions.text: To place between - What word, ending with a long a sound, has this definition?
questions.explanation:
interlay.

	Or interplay.

questions.text: A bird - What word, ending with a long a sound, has this definition?
questions.explanation:
jay.

	Can you think of any more?

questions.text: _______ Ballard or Danny _______ - What word, ending with a long a sound, could fit in the blanks?
questions.explanation:
Kaye.

	Danny Kaye shortened his name from Kaminsky (some of his cousins shortened theirs to Kamin). Kaye Ballard was on Desilu's hit comedy show The Mothers-in-Law from 1967 to 1969. She and Eve Arden made a terrific comedy team.

questions.text: Reclined - What word, ending with a long a sound, has this definition?
questions.explanation:
lay.

	Or Lillet--a sweet wine. Or love-vay (what Mr. Howell calls his wife on Gilligan's Island).

questions.text: A month - What word, ending with a long a sound, has this definition?
questions.explanation:
May.

	Or Monet or Manet or Edna St. Vincent Millay.

questions.text: Whinny - What word, ending with a long a sound, has this definition?
questions.explanation:
neigh.

	Or nay.

questions.text: Comply - What word, ending with a long a sound, has this definition?
questions.explanation:
obey.

	Or Oil of Olay or the Spanish word Ole!

questions.text: Communicate with God - What word, ending with a long a sound, has this definition?
questions.explanation:
pray.

	Or play or pay or liver pate.

questions.text: A pier - What word, ending with a long a sound, has this definition? (US pronunciation)
questions.explanation: quay.

questions.text: Instant _______ - What word, ending with a long a sound, could go in the blank?
questions.explanation:
replay.

	Or relay or manta ray or Ray Bradbury or a ray of sunshine or Man Ray.

questions.text: To kill OR to do very well on stage in a comedy routine - What word, ending with a long a sound, has this definition?
questions.explanation:
slay.

	Or say or spay or spray or Bain de Soleil.

questions.text: A men's hairpiece - What word, ending with a long a sound, has this definition?
questions.explanation:
toupee.

	Or tray or today or tres bien, merci, or toorah-loorah-lay!

questions.text: The opposite of 'emphasize' - What word, ending with a long a sound, has this definition?
questions.explanation:
underplay.

	Or unsay.

questions.text: Oy _____!  - What word, ending with a long a sound, could fit in the blank?
questions.explanation:
vey & vai & vay.

	A knowledgeable party informs me that 'vey' means 'woe.' 'Oi vai iz mir' means 'Oh, woe is me!'

questions.text: How much do you _______ - What word, ending with a long a sound, could fit in the blank?
questions.explanation:
weigh.

	No way!

questions.text: I'm not skipping X this time (I'm skipping Z, instead). If your doctor thinks you have fractured a bone, she will send you to get an _______.  - What word, ending with a long a sound, fits in the blank?
questions.explanation: X ray.

questions.text: We're done! _______!  - What word, ending with a long a sound, could fit in the blank?
questions.explanation:
Yay & Yea.

	Yay, verily. Zay, by the way, can be a last name, a first name, or an "urban slang" word, as in "I want zay. I love zay." I guess it is a sort of interchangeable objective pronoun that can mean "it," "him," or "her." Young people: correct me if I am wrong.
